John.1.1.note: Early papyrus where the article before Θεός is absent, often cited for qualitative nuance.
Critical text retains the article before Λόγος to signal subject emphasis.

John.1.1.reading: In the beginning was the Word
John.1.1.note: Traditional English rendering foregrounds the Word's pre-existence.

Luke.2.2.note: Majority reading identifying the census as the first when Quirinius was governing Syria.
Syriac tradition mirrors the majority Greek reading with emphasis on sequence.
